episode_body:
On October 14, 2024 at 11:16 AM, Bryce Koon emailed Lee Sitlinger:

Case: Kimberly-Brasher-Premise-2-25-2023
Client: Kimberly Brasher
__Kimberly Brasher v. Walgreens (McLean 24-CI-00012)__
Cc: Kimberly Brasher Premise 2/25/2023 - Filevine Project Email Address [KimberlyBrasherSFZ3954564@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com](mailto:KimberlyBrasherSFZ3954564@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com), Sarena Tuttle [sarena@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:sarena@whaleylawfirm.com)
Good afternoon counsel,
Please see the attached documents discussed during Ms. Brasher's
deposition.
I would also like to follow up on the discovery requests we served to
Walgreens, as well as request some dates for a corporate rep deposition for
your client.
Finally, our office sent over a demand a while back, have you had any
opportunity to review it? If you and your client are interested in
attempting mediation in lieu of further litigation and informal
negotiations, we could try and get something on the books.
Sorry for throwing all of that at you, just figured I'd knock it all out
with one email!
Thank you,
*W. Bryce Koon, Esq.*
The Whaley Law Firm
712 Lyndon Lane
Louisville, KY 40222
*This electronic message is intended only for the named recipient. It may
contain attorney-client privileged or otherwise protected information. If
you have received this message or any attachment in error, you are
instructed to contact The Whaley Law Firm and advise in this regard, no
waiver of any privilege shall be applicable, and you are instructed that
you should not use the information contained herein or forward it to any
third person not intended to receive it. *

episode_body:
Case: Kimberly-Brasher-Premise-2-25-2023
Client: Kimberly Brasher

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Recvd Client Email:
Thank you for your response. I wasn’t aware of anyone’s retirement, the defense counsel changing, or anything else that may be holding up the defendant’s response to my claim. I do expect the hospitals and other medical providers to put a garnishment on me any day now, which is why I have an urgent interest in finding out if we’re any closer to a settlement or lack thereof. I’m not in regular contact with your office, so please give me some grace if I sound pushy-I started my claim a year or better ago, and was not aware this would be such a lengthy process or endeavor. Thank you.

Reply to Client:
Good morning Kim,
 I can definitely understand your frustration with the process, I greatly apologize that you were not better informed as to how long litigation typically takes. On a standard Circuit Court Case can take 2 years easily, without any snags or delays. Your claim however is right on track with that timeline. The Defense did make a speedy change and we do not anticipate a huge delay for the new counsel to catch up. We anticipate scheduling Mediation in the Spring, if the Defense is not open to settlement discussion once they are caught up. If you are being contacted by medical providers related to this claim, please advise them that the bills are in a pending litigation and feel free to provide our contact information to anyone attempting to collect them, please do not let them go into collections or cause any further issues for yourself. We are here to help you with those. If you have any other questions, please do not hesitate to contact us to discuss them in further detail. 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: November 26 2024

__Your Mediation has been scheduled - February 25th, 2025 1:30pm__
CC: Bryce Koon [bryce@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:bryce@whaleylawfirm.com), Aaron Whaley [agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com)
Good afternoon Kimberly,
 Please find attached our office's Notice of Mediation Scheduling. The
Defense has agreed to mediate with Hon. Thomas Knopf, a former Circuit
Court Judge, who is extremely familiar with your type of claim. You,
Bryce/Aaron, and the Defense will conference with Mr. Knopf in an effort to
resolve your claim without a formal Trial. Please take some time to think
about your claim and what you anticipate would be an acceptable resolution.
Please bear in mind that your claim value is directly related to the
medical treatment you received.
 Once you have taken this time, please contact our office to schedule a
time to conference with Bryce and/or Aaron to discuss your mediation in
further detail. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to
contact us directly to discuss them in further detail.

Reviewing activity in Kimberly Brasher Premise 2/25/2023 between 12/25/2024 and 1/24/2025...

episode_body:
Case: Kimberly-Brasher-Premise-2-25-2023
Client: Kimberly Brasher

Mediation unsuccessful. Top "official" offer was 25k, but they indicated they could get up to 50k. I think this case is worth more than that. 

DC is taking the position that client was a trespasser to which Walgreens owed no duty. There is no way that is correct, but they said they intend on filing a motion for summary on that issue. Going to set up the Walgreens corporate rep depo and respond to their MSJ when it comes, then try to revisit negotiations.

Thank you for the email. I have sent several emails to Aaron that have gone without a response. First, I sent an email back in April asking if you would be interested in negotiating an agreed scheduling order regarding discovery, experts, motions, pretrials and trial dates. I sent a second email on June 12th requesting responses to our client’s discovery served back in September. I don’t see that we have received those and request that these be produced within the next 7 days. As for the corporate rep deposition, I will need to see what topics you are wanting as this case is not one that seems ripe for a corporate rep deposition given the store was closed at the time your client fell in the vacant parking lot. Depending on the topics, we may need to discuss this one with the Court.
Happy to jump on a call to discuss. If you prefer not to enter into a scheduling order, I am going to proceed with filing a Motion for a Status Conference with the Court to get some dates on the books.
Thanks, Bryce.
Matt

Stadler [steven.stadler@qpwblaw.com](mailto:steven.stadler@qpwblaw.com), Inga A. Fonov [inga.fonov@qpwblaw.com](mailto:inga.fonov@qpwblaw.com)
Counsel,
Thanks for the follow-up. We’ll have the discovery responses over to you in
the coming days.
Regarding the 30.02(6) deposition, the topics will address control and
maintenance of the property following closure, any inspections or upkeep
performed, the presence or absence of signage or warnings, and Walgreens’
general policies for closed locations. We’ll also cover whether any steps
were taken to evaluate or document the condition of the premises before or
after the incident.
I understand your position, but given the circumstances, we believe these
are appropriate areas for corporate testimony. I’m happy to share the topic
list once it's finalized and discuss any concerns you have before we
proceed with noticing it.
Thank you,
*W. Bryce Koon, Esq.*

episode_body:
Case: Kimberly-Brasher-Premise-2-25-2023
Client: Kimberly Brasher

Completed comprehensive file organization using 5-phase pipeline. Successfully reorganized 373 files into 8-bucket system. Results: 222 files moved to proper buckets, 31 duplicates deleted, 20 files flagged for manual review. Quality review showed 0.78% error rate (excellent). All medical records organized by provider with subfolder structure. Litigation documents properly dated using Certificate of Service dates. Case now fully organized and ready for active case work.
